title: [Large-Scale] Iterative Instructional Design Scenarios Based on Mathematical Modeling for Improving Online Introductory Biology Courses: Statistical Analysis and Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic biology concepts, curriculum management experience, foundational statistics (mean/variance/standard deviation) and data analysis skills, and comprehension of linear regression models
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment for managers/leaders in corporate settings to improve online introductory biology courses by applying mathematical modeling (optimization problems, probabilistic models) and statistical methods (hypothesis testing, regression analysis). Learners acquire skills to calculate ROI for STEM education efficiency using real corporate data.

learning_goals: Improve content organization efficiency of an online biology course by ≥20% through probabilistic distribution and optimization modeling analysis via 3 iterative improvements.
Derive optimal learning activity designs based on confidence intervals after verifying statistical significance via t-tests and ANOVA by comparing experimental and control groups using A/B testing.

Perform multiple regression analysis on learning performance indicators of a revised course using corporate internal data (completion rate ≥85%, assessment score ≥70) during a 2-week project period and produce a data-driven report proposing improvement plans for ≥3 out of 5 core indicators.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
